content.description: An environmental agency wants to evaluate the effectiveness of rain gardens in reducing the impact of urban runoff from an impervious parking lot and from the roof of the building. The parking lot is slightly sloped so the rainwater flows toward the gardens. The runoff from the roof is collected by various downspouts and directed toward the gardens. Scientists at the agency plan to monitor the effectiveness by measuring the water quality of the storm water as it moves through the gardens during and after storm events.
content.question: Plant selection is important for a rain garden. Which of the following best describes the types of plants that would be most effective to use in the rain garden in this experimental design to reduce the impact of urban runoff?

choices.label: Flowering plant species so that offspring are genetically different from the parent plants
Flood-tolerant plant species so that the plants can withstand large pulses of water from storms
Invasive plant species so that the plants can reproduce rapidly once the soil is saturated from storms
Genetically modified plant species so that the plants are resistant to drought and insect pests

content.answer: Flood-tolerant plant species so that the plants can withstand large pulses of water from storms
